definition: (of the weather) to warm up again
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)

sentences.english: Treatment can be painful and involves the gentle rewarming of the frostbitten body part.
sentences.chinese: 治疗可能会很辛苦，需要使冻伤的部位逐渐回暖。

sentences.english: Markets have rallied very fast, but they fell just as quickly in the six months to March.
sentences.chinese: 市场在三月份前的的六个月里乍然回暖又骤然降温。

sentences.english: Potential home buyers afraid of committing to a fast- depreciating asset have been clamoring for signs of stabilization in house prices.
sentences.chinese: 潜在的购房者担心房价回暖是大肆贬值前的虚张声势。

sentences.english: Hiring is starting to pick up again, recruiters and bankers say.
sentences.chinese: 招聘正在开始再度回暖，招聘者和银行家们说。

sentences.english: Greater resilience is a shared objective.
sentences.chinese: 大范围的回暖是共有的客观事实。

sentences.english: The other is that financial crises usually produce weak recoveries.
sentences.chinese: 另一股则是金融危机通常会导致柔弱的回暖。

sentences.english: We love the smell of the earth warming and the sound of cattle lowing.
sentences.chinese: 我们爱闻大地回暖的气息，爱听牛群哞叫。

sentences.english: After an hour, there was little sign of confidence returning, with the Footsie still 6% down at 9am.
sentences.chinese: 开盘一个小时后，伦敦市场几乎没有任何回暖的迹象。

sentences.english: Although the real estate market become warmer in the Spring 2009, but the future trend remains unclear.
sentences.chinese: 2009年开春市场有所回暖，但未来走势仍未明朗。

sentences.english: At this time the earth has warmed up, Chaya very immature.
sentences.chinese: 此时大地刚刚回暖，茶芽非常稚嫩。

sentences.english: Maybe, the time when Hong Kong real estate rejuvenates is his day of fortune rising?
sentences.chinese: 或许，香港地产业回暖之时，又是他的身家大涨之日。

sentences.english: AF says the process of rewarming a person needs to be done slowly in a hospital setting.
sentences.chinese: AF说在医院里，让伤员回暖的过程要比较缓慢。

definition: to rise again after a fall/to pick up/rally (stock market etc)
variant of 復甦|复苏[fu4 su1]/to recover (health, economic)/to resuscitate/anabiosis
to become hot/temperature rise/(fig.) to intensify/to hot up/to escalate/to get a boost
to improve/to take a turn for the better/improvement
to fall back/to return to low level after a rise (in water level, price etc)
to slow down/to ease up/to abate/slowdown/downturn
to decline/to drop/to fall/to go down/to decrease
a turn for the better/to pick up/to improve
